title: ICE / ETERNITE
description: this dialogue for pushing over eternite for you know very darksoulsy shortcut, yes, gut design.

dialogueTree.title: Pile of Eternite: "A pane of eternite has been planted..."
dialogueTree.text: A pane of eternite has been planted into the snow. Two poles are holding it up.

links.title: Interfacing: "*Barely* holding it up. It could fa..."
links.text: *Barely* holding it up. It could fall over any minute... a stronger gust of wind might be enough.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like a makeshift bridge."..."
links.text: "It looks like a makeshift bridge." The lieutenant adjusts his collar against a cool breeze. "Could be convenient."

links.title: Pile of Eternite: "Looks like a makeshift bridge, curr..."
links.text: Looks like a makeshift bridge, currently drawn up.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "When junior researcher Õlari Taal i..."
links.text: When junior researcher Õlari Taal invented eternite in the un-prestigious Värtna Polytechnic Institute some thirty odd years ago, he thought it would last forever -- hence the name eternite. The only lasting thing about it turned out to be its carcinogenic effect.

links.title: Pile of Eternite: "The pane falls into the icy snow wi..."
links.text: The pane falls into the icy snow with a soft thunk.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should ask that girl on the ice..."
links.text: "We should ask that girl on the ice what's going on here." The lieutenant gestures toward the young woman next to the tent.
